page.title: 02LANDSCAPE AT TURNASTONE
page.content: Turnastone and St.Margarets are situated in a U shaped valley.The valley was formed by a glacier which shaped it millions of years ago.It is situated in the foothills of the Black Mountains which are a range that run between Crickhowell and Hay-on-Wye. The main soils of the area are Limestone,Sandstone and Shale.The highest mountain in the range is Pen-y-gader-fawr which is 2624 feet.The welsh name for the foothills of the Black Mountains and the mountains is Mynydd Du. The main land use is farming land,both rough and crop growing land.Woodland is also in the area.
